title: Can Taylor Fritz win the Indian Wells title again?
description: Taylor Fritz was the surprise champion at Indian Wells in 2022. And after a massive 2024 season, he's a favorite to win a second time.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: The BNP Paribas Open at Indian Wells: What to know and who to watch
description: Who will win with Sinner out? How will Keys follow up her first major title? Answering the big questions as the BNP Paribas Open begins Wednesday.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Raducanu to start trial with coach Platenik
description: Emma Raducanu will begin a trial period with Slovakian coach Vladimir Platenik when she plays her first-round match at Indian Wells on Thursday.

title: Raducanu 'couldn't see ball through tears' in stalking incident
description: Emma Raducanu says she "couldn't see the ball through tears" during her recent stalking incident and that the situation could have been dealt with better.

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let‚Äôs take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Nishikori conquers cramp, Munar in Indian Wells opener
description: Kei Nishikori returned to BNP Paribas Open action in dramatic fashion on Wednesday in Indian Wells. Competing at the hard-court ATP Masters 1000 for the first time since 2021, Nishikori overcame physical struggles to down a fired-up Jaume Munar 6-2, 5-7, 7-6(3) and earn a second-round spot. The former World No. 4 called for the physio for a leg injury midway through the third set and within two games was also struggling with cramp, but he nonetheless held firm for a two-hour, 57-minute victory. ‚ÄúIt was not easy. I almost gave up because I was struggling with my body,‚Äù said Nishikori. ‚ÄúIn the third set I was cramping pretty badly, but somehow I came back and won, so a very good match.‚Äù Earned not given ü•ã In just under three hours, @keinishikori sets up a second round meeting with No. 18 seed Humbert! @BNPPARIBASOPEN | #TennisParadise pic.twitter.com/VzQWySsuqr ‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) March 5, 2025 Nishikori has battled back from long-term injury to reestablish himself in the Top 100 of the PIF ATP Rankings, and in January he reached his first ATP Tour final for six years in Hong Kong. Currently the World No. 76, he seemed set for a routine victory in his maiden Lexus ATP Head2Head meeting with Munar after making a fast start, but the match became complicated after he let slip a 4-3 lead with a break in the second set. ‚ÄúI knew I was playing well from the beginning, and he took the chance in the second set, but even then, I was still happy with my tennis,‚Äù reflected Nishikori. ‚ÄúI just tried to stay focused and I think he had more chances in the third set, but I tried to compete and fight until the end.‚Äù After saving 10 of 14 break points he faced against Munaur in Indian Wells, according to Infosys ATP Stats, Nishikori set a second-round meeting with 18th seed Ugo Humbert. [HOT SHOT] In other early Day 1 action in the California desert, wild card Tristan Boyer enjoyed a dream Masters 1000 main-draw debut by securing a 4-6, 6-2, 7-6(4) victory against Aleksandar Vukic. Boyer, whose only previous match in Indian Wells was a first-round qualifying encounter as a 16-year-old seven years ago, will next take on his countryman and 10th seed Tommy Paul. Thiago Seyboth Wild and Christopher O‚ÄôConnell each notched three-set triumphs to kick-start their BNP Paribas Open campaigns. Seyboth Wild saved two match points in the deciding set before prevailing 4-6, 7-5, 7-6(6) against Alexandre Muller, while O‚ÄôConnell won a topsy-turvy duel with Roberto Carballes Baena 6-3, 0-6, 6-1. In the second round, Seyboth Wild will take on last week‚Äôs Dubai champion Stefanos Tsitsipas, while O‚ÄôConnell plays Matteo Berrettini. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Take our BNP Paribas Open quiz
description:
With the BNP Paribas Open underway this week at the Indian Wells Tennis Garden, it's time to test your knowledge of tournament champions. How well do you know the season's first ATP Masters 1000? We've put two minutes on the clock. Ready? Play!

Which two players are tied for most men's singles titles in Indian Wells?

  • Djokovic & Federer
  • Djokovic & Nadal
  • Federer & Nadal

Which player did Carlos Alcaraz defeat in the final the past two years?

  • Taylor Fritz
  • Daniil Medvedev
  • Jannik Sinner

Before Taylor Fritz's triumph in 2022, who was the last American to win the Indian Wells title?

  • Andre Agassi
  • Michael Chang
  • Pete Sampras

Which British player won the BNP Paribas Open title in 2021?

  • Daniel Evans
  • Andy Murray
  • Cameron Norrie

Which player saved three championship points to defeat Roger Federer in the 2018 Indian Wells final?

  • Juan Martin del Potro
  • Novak Djokovic
  • Dominic Thiem

title: Indian Wells Draw 2025
description: The first Masters 1000 tournament of the season is upon us, and the 2025 Indian Wells draw has landed, with main draw play commencing on Wednesday, 5th March. There is no Jannik Sinner in the draw after the Italian negotiated a 3-month ban for his two failed doping tests, and he will return in time ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan

title: Sinner Dominates in One Sided Australian Open Final
description: Jannik Sinner successfully defended his Australian Open title on Sunday, landing his third Grand Slam commandingly with a 6-3, 7-6(4), 6-3 victory over Alexander Zverev. Sinner was ruthless from the baseline and did not face a single break point throughout the two-hour, 42-minute final. The Italian showed his extra firepower from the outset, which has ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan
